content.description: Climb up the three-tiered cracks climbing and swapping to the right as needed. The angle and footholds make this easier than it looks from the ground. We found a single nut in the crack when climbing up, we down cleaned. No anchor we could find.. name is just a guess?
content.protection: Doubles in off fingers/tight hands. Something to lower off, no anchor?
content.location: Just above the camp area with the big cottonwoods on the south side. Just right of the right facing dihedral obvious twin cracks with a smaller third crack on the right.

content.description: Climb the left side of the arch in a twin corner crack system. This beast starts with a bit of easier and spookier wide climbing (seems pretty hollow!) to slammer hands into thin laybacking and stemming with some switching between cracks. When the crack peiters out, plug some gear and go for a wild quest on thin face crimps and meet up with the roof. On the FA Ben pulled a lot of flakes off the face be warned the giant whip pendulum should be avoided. We tried to get him to place a bolt or just a 1/4 incher with no hanger but he wouldnt budge, do it in good style like Ben and you'll be awarded fully!
content.protection: .2 - #6, save a six for the end once you reach the roof!
content.location: On the opposite side of the river from Keg Springs. Find this area by finding the Cottonwoods campground next to the 5.12 OW roof. Hike upstream following a series of cairns till water meets the cliff band, above looms an arch with climbs up each side, meeting in the center at the anchor.

content.description: Start just right of Freshman Girls in the obvious wide crack. Maneuver into the crack and squeeze your way to the top! Some good ol fashioned chicken wings, a short route too. Don't expect indian creek length or quality out here, just rattlesnake bites and tipped out 6’s. If you're lucky Ben will give you a peek.
content.protection: 1 hand sized piece for the bottom, 1 optional #5 for the top, 1-2 #6's for the wide although they are a bit tipped out. A single Sling for the chock if you are a boss.

content.description: Keg Stand Follow a leaning corner through a variety of sizes. Start with a few moves  squeeze/offwidth and follow the corner to anchors at the top
content.location: The route is on the west side of the canyon . Locate a left leaning corner to the right of large boulder.

content.description:
Looking to invert? Looking to tic one of greens burly OW's? This is your route! Obvious wide crack that goes through a large roof. Start with easier climbing up through a fun funky chossy and loose section to where you can establish into the roof off fist jams. Invert traverse your way through the wide and pivot at the roof. Easier climbing to the chains!

Watch out what ya grab and where you place gear! We were still able to pull some sizable stuff out of the begining of this route.
content.protection: A few hands to big hands pieces, 1-2 size 5 camalot and an optional six for the last section before the chains.
content.location: Off to the left of the river on a large boulder 1/4 mile before Keg Spring Canyon.

content.description: Your typical basic freshman boy at the kegger. Climb up flared but good hands, the angle begins to kick back as the crack gets smaller and more techy. Good faceholds offer some relief, but it isnt over till the chains, or in this case a piton and a nut. Enjoy!
content.protection: doubles in big hands to off fingers gear! Anchor is a piton/nut.
content.location: First route left of the varnished steep splitter aka freshman girls

content.description: Climb some rotten, sandy, but fairly easy terrain without pro. Place your first decent piece (#3) about 20ft off the deck. Climb to the back of the chimney to set up for the traverse. Shimmy your way out until you reach a bomber hand crack! I was happy to have a #4 for this section, could also bring a #5 if so desired. Once pulling the lip, #2s quickly become #1s, then 0.75s for the last bit. 2 bolt anchor at the top courtesy of Anus Herder, shared with Nice Dick. Don't wear shorts!
content.protection: A range, bring 2 #1 for the hand crack and a #4 for the chimney traverse. Only the beginning is a bit spicy/dirty, the rest is SPLITTER BABY!
content.location: The line is the right side of the arch feature that shapes the wall. This wall is located on the opposite side of the river and up ~1/4 mile from Keg Springs. Find this area by finding the Cottonwoods campground next to the 5.12 OW roof. Hike upstream following a series of cairns till water meets the cliff band, above looms an arch with climbs up each side, meeting in the center at the anchor.

content.description: Absolutely Splitter, but a short route. Get those hands in the smallest part of the crack on a slab then quickly kick back to where you can go fist deep climbing through 2 small overhangs. Hope your fists are big enough. It's a bit wide but will regardlessly have you coming back! A great lil route for this nook of the canyon!
content.protection: 3, 3.5, 4, optional 5. Tat on blocks at top.
content.location: Located upstream from the cottonwood trees 100m it's on your left heading up the canyon.
